title: DSM-5 Criteria for Major Depressive Disorder
description: Diagnostic criteria for major depressive disorder (MDD) based on DSM-5. Evaluates presence of core symptoms, duration, functional impairment, and exclusion criteria for major depressive episodes.

parameters.name: depressed_mood
parameters.description: Depressed mood most of the day, nearly every day

parameters.name: anhedonia
parameters.description: Markedly diminished interest or pleasure in all, or almost all, activities most of the day, nearly every day

parameters.name: weight_appetite_change
parameters.description: Significant weight loss/gain (>5% body weight in a month) or decrease/increase in appetite nearly every day

parameters.name: sleep_disturbance
parameters.description: Insomnia or hypersomnia nearly every day

parameters.name: psychomotor_changes
parameters.description: Psychomotor agitation or retardation nearly every day (observable by others)

parameters.name: fatigue_energy_loss
parameters.description: Fatigue or loss of energy nearly every day

parameters.name: worthlessness_guilt
parameters.description: Feelings of worthlessness or excessive/inappropriate guilt nearly every day

parameters.name: concentration_problems
parameters.description: Diminished ability to think or concentrate, or indecisiveness, nearly every day

parameters.name: suicidal_thoughts
parameters.description: Recurrent thoughts of death, recurrent suicidal ideation, suicide attempt, or specific plan for suicide

parameters.name: duration_two_weeks
parameters.description: Symptoms present for at least 2 weeks, most of the day, nearly every day

parameters.name: functional_impairment
parameters.description: Symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of functioning

parameters.name: not_substance_medical
parameters.description: Episode NOT attributable to physiological effects of substance use or medical condition

parameters.name: not_better_explained
parameters.description: NOT better explained by schizoaffective disorder, schizophrenia, delusional disorder, or other specified/unspecified schizophrenia spectrum disorders

parameters.name: no_manic_hypomanic_history
parameters.description: Has NEVER had a manic episode or hypomanic episode

result.name: dsm5_mdd_diagnosis
result.description: DSM-5 Major Depressive Disorder diagnostic result

ranges.interpretation: Does not meet DSM-5 criteria for Major Depressive Disorder. Consider other mood disorders, adjustment disorders, or subclinical depression. Refer for comprehensive evaluation if clinical concerns persist.

ranges.description: Meets criteria for major depressive episode
ranges.interpretation: Meets DSM-5 criteria for Major Depressive Disorder. Requires comprehensive psychiatric evaluation and treatment planning. Consider psychotherapy, medication, or combination treatment based on severity and patient preferences.

references: American Psychiatric Association. Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders: DSM-5. 5th ed. Washington, DC: American Psychiatric Association; 2013.

Uher R, Payne JL, Pavlova B, Perlis RH. Major depressive disorder in DSM-5: implications for clinical practice and research of changes from DSM-IV. Depress Anxiety. 2014;31(6):459-71. doi: 10.1002/da.22217.
Fried EI, Nesse RM. Depression sum-scores don't add up: why analyzing specific depression symptoms is essential. BMC Med. 2015;13:72. doi: 10.1186/s12916-015-0325-4.
formula: Diagnostic evaluation based on DSM-5 criteria: â‰¥5 symptoms including at least one core symptom (depressed mood OR anhedonia) + 2-week duration + functional impairment + exclusion of substance/medical causes and other psychiatric conditions. Core symptoms: depressed mood, anhedonia. Additional symptoms: weight/appetite change, sleep disturbance, psychomotor changes, fatigue, worthlessness/guilt, concentration problems, suicidal thoughts.
notes: This is a diagnostic aid for clinical evaluation, not a substitute for comprehensive psychiatric assessment.
At least ONE core symptom (depressed mood OR anhedonia) MUST be present.
Requires at least 5 total symptoms from the 9-symptom list for diagnosis.
Symptoms must be present most of the day, nearly every day for at least 2 weeks.
Functional impairment and clinical distress are required for diagnosis.
Must rule out substance-induced mood disorder and mood disorder due to medical condition.
Excludes bipolar disorder (no history of manic or hypomanic episodes).
Consider bereavement exclusion and normal grief reactions in context of significant loss.
Assess suicide risk immediately if suicidal ideation is present.
Severity specifiers (mild, moderate, severe) and other specifiers should be considered.
